definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
regular men's haircut/short back and sides

sentences.english: We stand for independent management of export and import transactions under unified leadership.
sentences.chinese: 我们主张分头经营，统一领导。

sentences.english: Steve had been meeting with the bankers in separate groups .
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫分头去和一批批的银行家会晤。

sentences.english: Oriental white back to the inn, Li found three in, and Tian Kui split up.
sentences.chinese: 东方白回到客栈，发现李三不在，与田奎分头行动。

sentences.english: The race started and both men sped off in their chariots.
sentences.chinese: 比赛开始了，两个人分头赶着车飞快地跑着。

sentences.english: Forty people showed up. And they all had something to do.
sentences.chinese: 最后来了四十人，大家分头忙碌着。

sentences.english: Let's go about the work separately.
Groups of riders peel off in different directions.
sentences.chinese: 一群群的骑士们分头向各个方向前进。

sentences.english: The employees dispersed for the holidays.
sentences.chinese: 雇员们都分头度假去了。

sentences.english: Okay. I suggest we act separately.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，好，不如我们分头行动吧。

sentences.english: Ponytails are out but side-partings and Elvis quiffs are in.
sentences.chinese: 马尾辫“过时”，偏分头和短发受推崇。

sentences.english: Also separately buy a laboratory powders, films and film into a bundle of newsprint.
sentences.chinese: 又分头去买了洗印药粉，电影胶片和成捆的白报纸。

sentences.english: As your strike force grows you can split it into multiple groups to speed up the razing process.
sentences.chinese: 随着你部队的增长，你可以派部队分头去拆房子。

definition: the matter should not be delayed/there's no time to lose
to assign (a task to different people)/to allocate
to meet/to rendezvous/to merge/to link up/meeting/confluence
that very night/through the night/for several nights in a row

to dress (troops)/to line up (to arrange in a straight line)
to go on a journey/to leave
